text.p: These are the main stories in Latvian newspapers on Wednesday. Prepared for Reuters by the Co-operation Fund. Reuters has not verified these reports and does not vouch for their accuracy:

- President Guntis Ulmanis and Prime Minister Andris Skele signed an order reinstating Colonel Janis Dalbins as commander of Latvia's armed forces. Dalbins was exonerated by a special commission investigating a spate of murders and suicides in the country's army.
- Richard Holbrooke joins a Baltic Sea council established to examine security issues in the region.
- Prime Minister Skele's foreign affairs advisor says the Prime Minister's visit to Moscow will still take place but will probably be postponed to a later date.
- A court hearing the case of alleged mafia boss Ivan Kharitonov listened to videotape testimony by the late Vladimirs Dukats, who was killed in an explosion in 1994.
- The Latvian Foreign Minster criticises a story in Britain's Daily Telegraph that asserted Latvian forests and wildlife were being decimated by uncontrolled logging.
